title: Add QC statistics to the Spatial Experiment object — addPerROIQC

title: Add QC statistics to the Spatial Experiment object — addPerROIQC
text: spe_object spatial experiment object sample_fraction Double. Genes low count threshold samples removed. Default 0.9 rm_genes Logical. Decide whether genes low count sample_fraction samples removed dataset. Default TRUE. min_count Interger. Minimum read count calculate count threshold. Default 5. design Generate using model.matrix, specify, edgeR::filterByExpr used filter genes.

title: Add QC statistics to the Spatial Experiment object — addPerROIQC
text: spatial experiment object

what: Testing multiple K for RUV4 batch correction to find the best K. — findBestK
title: Testing multiple K for RUV4 batch correction to find the best K. — findBestK
text: Testing multiple K RUV4 batch correction find best K.

title: Testing multiple K for RUV4 batch correction to find the best K. — findBestK
code: findBestK(   spe,   maxK = 10,   factor_of_int,   factor_batch,   NCGs,   point_size = 3,   line_col = "black",   point_col = "black",   text_size = 13 )

title: Testing multiple K for RUV4 batch correction to find the best K. — findBestK
text: spe Spatial Experiment object. maxK Integer. max k test, test k 1 maxK, default 10. factor_of_int Column name(s) indicate factors interest. required RUV4 method. factor_batch Column name indicate batch. NCGs Negative control genes. required RUV4 method. point_size Numeric. Plotting parameter. line_col Character. Plotting parameter. point_col Character. Plotting parameter. text_size Numeric. Plotting parameter.

title: Testing multiple K for RUV4 batch correction to find the best K. — findBestK
text: ggplot object.

title: Testing multiple K for RUV4 batch correction to find the best K. — findBestK
code: data("dkd_spe_subset") spe <- findNCGs(dkd_spe_subset, top_n = 100) findBestK(spe,   factor_of_int = c("disease_status"),   factor_batch = "SlideName", NCGs = S4Vectors::metadata(spe)$NCGs )

what: Batch correction for GeoMX data — geomxBatchCorrection
title: Batch correction for GeoMX data — geomxBatchCorrection
text: Batch correction GeoMX data

title: Batch correction for GeoMX data — geomxBatchCorrection
code: geomxBatchCorrection(   spe,   k,   factors,   NCGs,   n_assay = 2,   batch,   covariates = NULL,   design = matrix(1, ncol(spe), 1),   method = c("RUV4", "Limma") )

title: Batch correction for GeoMX data — geomxBatchCorrection
text: spe Spatial Experiment object. k number unwanted factors use. Can 0. required RUV4 method. factors Column name(s) indicate factors interest. required RUV4 method. NCGs Negative control genes. required RUV4 method. n_assay Integer indicate nth count table assay(spe) used. batch vector indicating batches. required Limma mehtod. covariates matrix vector numeric covariates adjusted . design design matrix relating treatment conditions preserved, can generated using stats::model.matrix function biological factors included. method Can either RUV4 Limma, default RUV4.

title: Batch correction for GeoMX data — geomxBatchCorrection
text: Spatial Experiment object, containing ruv4-normalised count normalisation factor.

title: Batch correction for GeoMX data — geomxBatchCorrection
text: Gagnon-Bartsch, J. ., Jacob, L., & Speed, T. P. (2013). Removing unwanted variation high dimensional data negative controls. Berkeley: Tech Reports Dep Stat Univ California, 1-112. Ritchie, M. E., Phipson, B., Wu, D. ., Hu, Y., Law, C. W., Shi, W., & Smyth, G. K. (2015). limma powers differential expression analyses RNA-sequencing microarray studies. Nucleic acids research, 43(7), e47-e47.

title: Batch correction for GeoMX data — geomxBatchCorrection
code: data("dkd_spe_subset") spe <- findNCGs(dkd_spe_subset, top_n = 100) spe_ruv <- geomxBatchCorrection(spe,   k = 3,   factors = c("disease_status", "region"),   NCGs = S4Vectors::metadata(spe)$NCGs )

what: Perform normalisation to GeoMX data — geomxNorm
title: Perform normalisation to GeoMX data — geomxNorm
text: Perform normalisation GeoMX data

title: Perform normalisation to GeoMX data — geomxNorm
code: geomxNorm(   spe_object,   method = c("TMM", "RPKM", "TPM", "CPM", "upperquartile", "sizefactor"),   log = TRUE )

title: Perform normalisation to GeoMX data — geomxNorm
text: spe_object spatial experiment object. method Normalisation method use. Options: TMM, RPKM, TPM, CPM, upperquartile, sizefactor. RPKM TPM require gene length information, added rowData(spe). Note TMM TMM + CPM. log Log-transformed .

title: Perform normalisation to GeoMX data — geomxNorm
text: spatial experiment object, second assay normalised count matrix.

title: Perform normalisation to GeoMX data — geomxNorm
text: Robinson, M. D., McCarthy, D. J., & Smyth, G. K. (2010). edgeR: Bioconductor package differential expression analysis digital gene expression data. Bioinformatics, 26(1), 139-140. Love, M., Anders, S., & Huber, W. (2014). Differential analysis count data–DESeq2 package. Genome Biol, 15(550), 10-1186.

title: Perform normalisation to GeoMX data — geomxNorm

title: Compare and evaluate different batch corrected data with plotting. — plotClusterEvalStats
code: plotClusterEvalStats(   spe_list,   bio_feature_name,   batch_feature_name,   data_names,   colors = NA )

title: Compare and evaluate different batch corrected data with plotting. — plotClusterEvalStats
text: spe_list list Spatial Experiment object. bio_feature_name common biological variation name. batch_feature_name common batch variation name. data_names Data names. colors Color values filing bars.

title: Compare and evaluate different batch corrected data with plotting. — plotClusterEvalStats
text: ggplot object.

title: Compare and evaluate different batch corrected data with plotting. — plotClusterEvalStats
code: library(scater) data("dkd_spe_subset") spe <- scater::runPCA(dkd_spe_subset) #> Warning: You're computing too large a percentage of total singular values, use a standard svd instead. spe2 <- spe spe3 <- spe plotClusterEvalStats(list(spe, spe2, spe3),   bio_feature_name = "region",   batch_feature_name = "SlideName", c("test1", "test2", "test3") )

title: Plot gene-wise QC plot — plotGeneQC
text: spe spatial experiment object. top_n Integer. Indicating top n genes plotted. Default 9. ordannots variables computations sort samples (tidy style). point_size Numeric. Point size. line_type Character. Line types ggplot. line_col Color line. line_cex Cex line. hist_col Color histogram. hist_fill Fill histogram. bin_num Bin numbers histogram. text_size Text size. layout_ncol Integer. Column number layout. Default 1. layout_nrow Integer. Row number layout. Default 2. layout_height Vector numerics length 2. Default c(1, .4). ... aesthetic mappings pass ggplot2::aes() dot plots.

text: ggplot object

text: edata DGEList, SummarizedExperiment ExpressionSet object containing gene expression data. ordannots variables computations sort samples (tidy style). ... aesthetic mappings pass ggplot2::aes_string(). assay numeric character, specifying assay use (SummarizedExperiment derivative classes).

title: Compute and plot relative log expression (RLE) values of gene expression data — plotRLE
text: ggplot2 object, containing RLE plot.

title: Compute and plot relative log expression (RLE) values of gene expression data — plotRLE
code: se <- emtdata::cursons2018_se() #> see ?emtdata and browseVignettes('emtdata') for documentation #> loading from cache dge <- emtdata::asDGEList(se) plotRLE(dge,   colour = Subline, lty = Treatment, lwd = 2, ordannots =     c(Subline, Treatment) ) #> Error in retrieveCellInfo(object, colour_by, exprs_values = by_exprs_values): object 'Subline' not found

code: plotROIQC(   spe_object,   x_axis = "AOINucleiCount",   y_axis = "lib_size",   x_lab = "AOINucleiCount",   y_lab = "Library size",   x_threshold = NULL,   y_threshold = NULL,   regression_col = "purple",   hist_col = "black",   hist_fill = "white",   bin_num = 50,   threshold_col = "red",   threshold_linetype = "dashed",   layout_ncol = 2,   layout_nrow = 2,   leyout_height = c(0.8, 2.5),   layout_width = c(2.5, 0.8),   ... )

title: Plot Sample-wise QC plot — plotROIQC
text: spe_object spatial experiment object. x_axis Numeric feature plot x axis. y_axis Numeric feature plot y axis. x_lab Label name x axis. y_lab Label name y axis. x_threshold Threshold draw. y_threshold Threshold draw. regression_col Color regression line. hist_col Color histograms. hist_fill Fill histograms. bin_num Bin numbers histograms. threshold_col Threshold line color. threshold_linetype Threshold line type. layout_ncol Column number layout. layout_nrow Row number layout. leyout_height Height layout. layout_width Width layout. ... aesthetic mappings pass ggplot2::aes() dot plots.

title: Plot Sample-wise QC plot — plotROIQC

what: Import GeoMX DSP data into a saptial experiment object from file paths — readGeoMx
title: Import GeoMX DSP data into a saptial experiment object from file paths — readGeoMx
text: Import GeoMX DSP data saptial experiment object file paths

title: Import GeoMX DSP data into a saptial experiment object from file paths — readGeoMx
code: readGeoMx(   dirPath,   countFile,   sampleAnnoFile,   featureAnnoFile = NA,   hasNegProbe = TRUE,   NegProbeName = "NegProbe-WTX",   colnames.as.rownames = c("TargetName", "SegmentDisplayName", "TargetName"),   coord.colnames = c("ROICoordinateX", "ROICoordinateY") )

title: Import GeoMX DSP data into a saptial experiment object from file paths — readGeoMx
text: dirPath folder path necessary tsv files. countFile tsv file. Count matrix, samples columns features/genes rows. first column gene names/ids. sampleAnnoFile tsv file. Sample annotations. featureAnnoFile tsv file. Feature/Gene annotations. hasNegProbe Logical. Default TRUE, indicating negative probe genes data. NegProbeName Character. Name negative probe genes, default NegProbe-WTX. colnames..rownames Vector characters, length 3. Column names used capture gene names, sample names gene names countFile, sampleAnnoFile featureAnnoFile, respectively. coord.colnames Vector characters, length 2. Column names used capture ROI coordinates.

title: Import GeoMX DSP data into a saptial experiment object from file paths — readGeoMx
text: SpatialExperiment object.

title: Import GeoMX DSP data into a saptial experiment object from file paths — readGeoMx
code: dirPath <- "" countFile <- system.file("extdata", "dkd_subset_TargetCountMatrix.txt", package = "standR") sampleAnnoFile <- system.file("extdata", "dkd_subset_Sample_Annotations.txt", package = "standR")  spe <- readGeoMx(dirPath, countFile, sampleAnnoFile, hasNegProbe = FALSE)

what: Import GeoMX DSP data into a saptial experiment object from DGEList object — readGeoMxFromDGE
title: Import GeoMX DSP data into a saptial experiment object from DGEList object — readGeoMxFromDGE
text: Import GeoMX DSP data saptial experiment object DGEList object

title: Import GeoMX DSP data into a saptial experiment object from DGEList object — readGeoMxFromDGE
code: readGeoMxFromDGE(dge_object, spatialCoord = NULL)

title: Import GeoMX DSP data into a saptial experiment object from DGEList object — readGeoMxFromDGE
text: dge_object DGEList object (created using edgeR::DGEList). spatialCoord matrix coordinates samples, rowname must cosistent colnames dge_object.

title: Import GeoMX DSP data into a saptial experiment object from DGEList object — readGeoMxFromDGE
text: SpatialExperiment object.

title: Import GeoMX DSP data into a saptial experiment object from DGEList object — readGeoMxFromDGE
code: # making a simple DGEList object ng <- 1000 ns <- 10 Counts <- matrix(rnbinom(ng * ns, mu = 5, size = 2), ng, ns) rownames(Counts) <- 1:ng y <- edgeR::DGEList(counts = Counts, group = rep(1:2, each = 5))  # transfer into spatial experiment object coords <- matrix(rnorm(2 * ns), 10, 2) spe <- readGeoMxFromDGE(dge_object = y, spatialCoord = coords) spe #> class: SpatialExperiment  #> dim: 1000 10  #> metadata(0): #> assays(2): counts logcounts #> rownames(1000): 1 2 ... 999 1000 #> rowData names(0): #> colnames(10): Sample1 Sample2 ... Sample9 Sample10 #> colData names(4): group lib.size norm.factors sample_id #> reducedDimNames(0): #> mainExpName: NULL #> altExpNames(0): #> spatialData names(0) : #> spatialCoords names(0) : #> imgData names(0):

what: Tools for nalysing Nanostring's GeoMX spatial transcriptomics data — standR-package
title: Tools for nalysing Nanostring's GeoMX spatial transcriptomics data — standR-package
text: standR implements series functions facilitate inspection, analysis visualization Nanostring's GeoMX DSP datasets. standR takes either csv files Nanostring DGEList object input, allowing multiple methods analyzed together.

title: Tools for nalysing Nanostring's GeoMX spatial transcriptomics data — standR-package
text: standR represents GeoMX DSP data SpatialExperiment objects, can easily integrated wide variety Bioconductor packages.standR generates various plots, QC distribution plots, dimension reduction plots RLE plots, quality control genes region interest (ROI) samples. Multiple normalisation batch correction methods also provided package well, ability compute statistics assessing normalisation/batch correction results.

title: Tools for nalysing Nanostring's GeoMX spatial transcriptomics data — standR-package
text: Ning Liu liu.n@wehi.edu.au
